Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian early patterned or Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with slight part of bowl; white slip; interior of bowl glazed; exterior glazed streaky brown; some traces of slip on underside; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 453 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The width and the height of the foot sherd are consistent with the Wild Goat and patterned styles. Both styles are contemporary. For parallels, see Lemos no. 77 from Cerveteri and nos. 236-7 (the Würzburg chalices).
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 760, pl. XXI, no. 760)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 411)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (25, fig. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0298) (phase 2)
